channel.title: Jonathan Peacher
channel.copyright: Made with by Jonathan Peacher

item.title: What Am I?
item.description: I am someone who generally writes code using web-based technologies. What am I? This question has bugged me for years and I think I’ve finally come to a conclusion. If you like spoilers, look at my home page or the TLDR below. If not, here is my breakdown. Keep in mind that there exists many more titles than I mention below, but I am just trying to focus on my field.

item.title: New Computer Who Dis?
item.description: Install Command Line Tools xcode-select --install Oh My Zsh sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)" Homebrew /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" pyenv node (need to consider a package manager) Applications Visual Studio Code Docker 1Password Things 3 iStat Menus 6 Magnet Bandwidth+ Progress

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Jonathan Peacher and I'm a Software Engineer. This is my little corner of the internet where you have find my personal projects, read my posts, find my resume, or get in contact! This site is hosted on GitHub and built by Hugo with the simple-hugo theme I built using Simple.css. Stats for nerds

item.title: Resume
item.description: summary { font-weight: normal; } Experience Software Engineer Texas Advanced Computing Center, Jan 2018 - Present Developed web applications utilized by over 9000 K12 admins, teachers, and students. Streamlined many aspects of managing our registration platform, allowing staff members to focus on empowering K12 CS educators instead of wrestling with systems. Built a cyber range portal from scratch that allows hundreds of students to participate in cybersecurity exercises in a safe environment.
